page.title: 19Employment/Guyzance Area.
page.content: Many of the people in the area are employed on farms or in jobs associated with farming eg. agricultural engineers.Traditionally farm workers were employed on a half- yearly term basis,hirings being held in May and November.It is still usual for workers to change jobs at these times although hiring fairs are no longer held.Increased mechanisation has meant that large farm units can operate efficiently with fewer workers.The redundant workers' cottages have been sold or let to retired workers or to tenants who find work outside the area.Some women are employed as domestic workers in the larger farm houses.People living in the new development in the north east sector tend to commute to their professional ocupations.There is little unemployment in the area.
